com.ae.apps.lib.review

Class AppReviewImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ae.apps.lib.review.AppReviewImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppReview

    public class AppReviewImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements AppReview
    An implementation for managing In-App Reviews Usage: Invoke this method whenever there is a user event considered as a positive interaction Typical example would be each time the user launches the app 
          AppReviewImpl.getInstance().userInteractionEvent(applicationContext)
    Invoke this method to kick of the In-App Review flow, which computes whether to show or not based on the user interaction events 
         AppReviewImpl.getInstance().launchAppReviewFlow(activity)

      • userInteractionEvent

        public void userInteractionEvent(android.content.Context context)
        Description copied from interface: AppReview
        User has interacted with the app in such a way as to update the conditions to show the app rating window. Examples include "launching the app", "using certain feature" Or anything that shows the user is interacting with the app
        Specified by:
        userInteractionEvent in interface AppReview
        Parameters:
        context - the context, use applicationContext

      • getReviewRequestThreshold

        A minimum value for the review threshold
        Returns:
        a value used as threshold

      • conditionsMetForShowingReview

        protected boolean conditionsMetForShowingReview(android.content.Context context)
        Performs the calculation to decide whether to show the in-app review flow
        Returns:
        true if conditions are met, false otherwise

        Description copied from interface: AppReview
